resources.title: Waves and motion
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Covers the fundamental principles of mechanical waves.

resources.title: Grade 12 - diffraction
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Diffraction is the bending and spreading of waves.

resources.title: Interference
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Interference is the phenomenon where two or more waves overlap.

resources.title: Mechanical waves
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Mechanical waves are disturbances that require a medium.

resources.title: Nature and propagation of light
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Describes the dual nature of light.

resources.title: Polarization
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Polarization is the phenomenon where oscillations of a wave are confined to a single plane.

resources.title: Wave motion
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Wave motion is the transfer of energy through a medium.

resources.title: Waves in pipes and strings
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Waves in pipes and strings involve vibrations producing sound waves.

resources.title: Electrons
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Electrons are subatomic particles with a negative charge.

resources.title: Photons
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Photons are elementary particles representing light quanta.

resources.title: Quantization of energy
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Quantization of energy means energy is emitted or absorbed in discrete amounts.

resources.title: Radio activity
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of particles or energy.

resources.title: Recent trends in physics
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Recent trends in physics focus on cutting-edge research.

resources.title: Semi conductor devices
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Semiconductors are materials with electrical properties that can be altered.

resources.title: Fluid statics
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Fluid statics studies fluids at rest and the forces exerted by or on them.

resources.title: Periodic motion
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Periodic motion is motion that repeats itself at regular time intervals.

resources.title: Rotational dynamics
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Rotational dynamics studies the motion of objects rotating about an axis.

resources.title: First law of thermodynamics
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: The first law of thermodynamics states that energy can neither be created nor destroyed.

resources.title: Second law of thermodynamics
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Second law states entropy of an isolated system always increases or remains constant.

resources.title: Electrical circuits
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: An electrical circuit is a closed path that allows electric current to flow.

resources.title: Alternating current
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Alternating current is an electric current that periodically reverses direction.

resources.title: Electromagnetic induction
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Electromagnetic induction is the process of generating an electric current in a conductor.

resources.title: Magnetic field
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: A magnetic field is a region around a magnetic material or a moving electric charge.

resources.title: Magnetic properties of materials
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: Magnetic properties describe how different materials respond to magnetic fields.

resources.title: Thermoelectric Effect
resources.subject: Physics
resources.description: The thermoelectric effect is the conversion of temperature differences into electricity.
